page.title: 02Communication/Wetton/Grindon
page.content: Telephones are one of the means of communication. There is a telephone box in Wetton. It is opposite Manor House Farm. There is another telephone box near the Cavalier pub in Grindon. Also there are telegraph poles. So people have telephones in their homes. Some of the locals get the 'Parish News'. Most of the people in the area have a television. The people get letters and also the Leek Post and Times from the postlady. Papers such as the Mirror, Star, etc. have to be bought in Waterhouses. Some of the people have radios. There are some notice boards. Some people have a C.B. in the house.
